p: Antibacterial activity of S. macrosiphon has not been fully investigated, however, Javidnia et al. reported the activity of methanolic extract of the plant against S. aureus and E. coli [ 29] which showed MIC values of 1 and 0.5Â mg/mL, respectively. It seemed that chloroform and ethyl acetate fractions were more potent than the methanolic extract against S. aureus. However, the methanolic extract was more potent than three fractions against E. coli.
